description: During the Implementation Phase, the developed and tested system is installed, configured, and deployed into the production environment.
This phase includes final preparations for deployment, data conversion, user training, and operational readiness verification.
The primary goal of this phase is to transition the Business Product from a development and testing environment into full operational use while ensuring stability and performance.
This phase concludes when the system is fully operational, accepted by the Business Owner, and approved for ongoing maintenance.

responsibilities.Business Owner: Certifies that the implemented system meets business requirements, signs off on acceptance, and authorizes production use.
responsibilities.End Users: Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT), receive training, and begin using the system in the operational environment.
responsibilities.Project Manager: Leads implementation and deployment activities, coordinates with all stakeholders, and ensures readiness for operational transition.
responsibilities.Integrated Project Team: Executes deployment, training, and transition tasks as directed by the Project Manager.

Critical Partners.Enterprise Architecture: Ensures that deployment activities comply with enterprise architecture standards and approved configurations.
Critical Partners.Security: Confirms completion of Authority to Operate (ATO), Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), and publication of System of Record Notice (SORN).
Critical Partners.Acquisition: Ensures closure of contracts and that all deliverables and procurement documentation are completed.
Critical Partners.Budget: Determines financial impacts of final implementation changes and revalidates baseline costs.
Critical Partners.Finance: Confirms financial closeout and accurate recording of all project expenditures.
Critical Partners.HR: Ensures necessary staffing is in place for operations and maintenance support.
Critical Partners.Section 508: Verifies that deployed systems continue to meet accessibility and usability standards.
Critical Partners.CPIC: Confirms the project remains within approved cost, schedule, and performance baselines.
Critical Partners.Performance: Validates that operational performance metrics are achieved.
Critical Partners.Records Management: Ensures that records and data migration comply with retention and compliance policies.

activities: Notify all affected customers and organizations of the implementation schedule, including: the schedule, benefits of the new system, differences between the old and new systems, customer guidelines during the phase, and support process contact details.
Finalize and approve the Implementation Plan.
Install, configure, and deploy the Business Product into the production environment.
Perform data conversion and migration from legacy systems, including data input and data verification to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Conduct verification of both system operation and data integrity by continuous validation during migration.
Perform parallel operations by running old and new systems simultaneously until the new system is fully authorized and stable, allowing fallback if issues arise.
Execute deployment and cutover strategies with minimal business disruption.
Perform final system verification and validation to confirm production readiness.
Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and obtain Business Owner approval for production use.
Deliver user and administrator training sessions and distribute training materials.
Execute contingency and rollback plans in the event of deployment issues.
Ensure publication of the System of Record Notice prior to the Operational Readiness Review.
Conduct the Operational Readiness Review (ORR) to validate deployment preparedness.
Obtain Authority to Operate (ATO) and finalize security and privacy documentation.
Transition system management and support responsibilities to operations staff.
Close out contracts, update acquisition documentation, and archive project records.
deliverables: Authority to Operate (ATO) and Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M).
Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Memoranda of Understanding (MOU).
Updated Budget, Financial, and Performance Reports.
Final Deployment and Data Conversion Records.

exit_criteria.objective: To ensure the system has been successfully deployed, accepted, and is ready for sustained operational support.
phase_specific: Deployment, data migration, and system configuration activities completed successfully.
Business Owner formally accepts the system for production use.
Operational staff trained and ready to assume system management responsibilities.
generic: All baselines reviewed and any variances resolved.
Stage Gate Review completed and approval granted to proceed to Operations and Maintenance Phase.

project_review: The Operational Readiness Review (ORR) confirms that all implementation activities have been completed and the system is ready for production.
The Implementation Review verifies that all deployment, data conversion, and training tasks were successfully executed and accepted by stakeholders.

stage_gate_review.title: Implementation Stage Gate Review
stage_gate_review.purpose: To determine whether the project is ready to transition into the Operations and Maintenance Phase.
focus: Completion and approval of all implementation deliverables.
Verification that system meets business, technical, and performance requirements.
Confirmation that all acceptance and authorization documentation has been signed and approved.
